definition: to take the blame for sb else/to compensate for one's crime/to get charges dropped (by paying money etc)

apex/crown of the head/top/roof/most/to carry on the head/to push to the top/to go against/to replace/to substitute/to be subjected to (an aerial bombing, hailstorm etc)/(slang) to "bump" a forum thread to raise its profile/classifier for headwear, hats, veils etc

sentences.english: "His grandmother even got down on her knees to beg the judges to put her in prison instead of the boy," said Zhang Lingying, a judge with the juvenile tribunal at Changning District People's Court.
sentences.chinese: 他的奶奶甚至跪下來求法官，讓她來替這個男孩頂罪。

definition: lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
variant of 定親|定亲[ding4 qin1]
to place righteousness before family (idiom); ready to punish one's own family if justice demands it
to take advantage of one's position to bully people (idiom)/to kick people around
lit. to settle accounts after autumn/settle scores at an opportune moment (idiom)
to use public office to avenge private wrongs
to judge between right and wrong/to reason things out
lit. killing the chicken to warn the monkey (idiom)/fig. to punish an individual as an example to others/pour encourager les autres
to die without a burial site/to die a pauper/a tragic end
pinyin: si3 wu2 zang4 shen1 zhi1 di4

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
